alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:46PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Aitkin, northern Pine, southwestern Carlton, central Crow Wing and southwestern Douglas Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 346 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Willow River, to near South Long Lake, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Willow River and Rutledge around 350 PM CDT. Bruno around 400 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cloverton and Duxbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
